p: SARS-CoV-2 shares an 80% RNA sequence homology with the acute respiratory syndrome-associated coronavirus (SARS-CoV). 2, 3 Some enzymes of both viruses show more than 90% sequence homology. 2 For example, RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp) of both coronaviruses shares 96% sequence similarity. 2 Accordingly, existing drugs against SARS-CoV and Middle East Respiratory Syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) may be also useful to fight COVID-19. 1, 3
